title: In memory of George Baskerville
content:
British crime author Sir [Arthur Conan Doyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203142029/http:/www.sherlockholmesonline.org/) named his story _The Hound of the Baskervilles_ after his compatriot John Baskerville’s well-known and much-venerated typeface. In my current photo op, Boroondara Kew Cemetery, last week I stumbled across [what looks to be the grave of a Baskerville](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203142029/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/arboghast/2898366374/) who lived in the late 19th century, one George Baskerville.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203142029im_/http:/typophile.com/files/george_baskerville_4480.jpg)

I plan to go back this week and take loads more pix of George Baskervile’s fallen tombstone. Many thanks to **flickr** pal [Tom Margie](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203142029/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/tom-margie/) for noticing the name on the monument.

j a m e s
author: James Arboghast
